alert.note: Alert for Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 24 at 2:14AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Minnesota and east central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind speeds have decreased, but remain breezy. Additional drifting snow is still possible this morning. Although visibility has improved, several areas still have no travel advised or roads closed due to previous drifting. Please continue to heed your local travel restrictions.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
